tool.name: SAGA.climate_tools.19
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayT True isArrayP True output_data_CLASSES $output_data_CLASSES name SAGA.climate_tools.19 T $T P $P METHOD $METHOD prefer $prefer response $response outputType_CLASSES $OutputSection_CLASSES.outputType_CLASSES transmissionMode_CLASSES $OutputSection_CLASSES.transmissionMode_CLASSES

param.name: T
param.label: Temperature
param.help: Temperature The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-aaigrid, png, x-ogc-envi, tiff

param.name: P
param.label: Precipitation
param.help: Precipitation The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-aaigrid, png, x-ogc-envi, tiff

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_CLASSES
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value

tool.help: This tool applies a climate classification scheme using monthly mean temperature and precipitation data. Currently implemented classification schemes are Koeppen-Geiger (1936), Thornthwaite (1931), and Troll-Paffen (1964). Because of some less precise definitions the Troll-Paffen scheme still needs some revisions.
